channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Millions of people may get expanded Social Security benefits. Who are they and how would it happen?
item.description: Nearly 3 million people could receive a boost in Social Security payments under legislation that’s set for a final vote in the Senate.

item.title: HIV is spiking in new hot spots. Here's what's being done to control it
item.description: As the new cases and related deaths fall in sub-Saharan Africa, the virus is rearing its head elsewhere. What's the cause? And the solution?

item.title: Suspect in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO will face federal charges, sources tell AP
BBC's Steve Rosenberg challenges Putin on his 25-year rule of Russia
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin was speaking at an annual end-of-year press conference.

item.title: HELOC or home equity loan: Which will be better in 2025?
item.description: Home equity loan and HELOC rates differ in numerous ways, which could influence your choice between the two.

item.title: I should have invaded Ukraine earlier, Putin tells Russians in TV marathon
item.description: Putin tells an end-of-year press conference there should have been "systemic preparation" for the full-scale invasion.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot's ex-husband jailed for 20 years in mass rape trial
item.description: The convictions bring to an end France's largest ever rape trial, which has shocked the country and world.

item.title: Possible government shutdown looms. And, tips to help with seasonal depression
item.description: Possible holiday government shutdown looms as President-elect Donald Trump and advisers like Elon Musk object to bipartisan spending bill. And, simple...

item.title: Like Old Times: Trump Sends Congress Scrambling To Avoid A Shutdown
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump and his newest top-lieutenant, Elon Musk, have sent Washington scrambling to avoid a government shutdown, even before Tru...

item.title: Texas moves to reverse impact of Biden immigration policies at U.S.-Mexico border
item.description: The Texas government is working to implement ways to deter illegal immigration at the U.S.-Mexico border as President-elect Donald Trump prepares to e...

item.title: Appeals court removes prosecutor Fani Willis from Georgia election case against Trump and others
Liquid-burning firepits behind 2 deaths, dozens of injuries, fed agency warn
item.description: Products sold as tabletop firepits, firepots, miniature fireplaces or portable fires for indoor use are "extremely dangerous," consumer agency warns.

item.title: Tate brothers human trafficking case sent back by Romanian court
item.description: A court upholds the influencer's challenge of the human trafficking case against him and his brother.

item.title: Think you can't dance? Get up and try these tips in our comic. We dare you!
item.description: Anyone can dance. As you read this comic, follow each step — and you'll be moving and grooving in no time.

item.title: Dozens of children killed in crush at Nigerian Christmas funfair
item.description: The widely advertised event saw large numbers of children show up, leading to a deadly crush.

item.title: Congress veers toward government shutdown after GOP revolt
item.description: After a Republican revolt led by Elon Musk and Donald Trump torpedoed a plan to fund the government, a new path forward remains unclear as Congress lu...

item.title: Georgia appeals court blocks Fulton DA Willis from election interference case
item.description: Fulton County DA Fani Willis and her office can't continue prosecuting the Georgia election interference case involving Donald Trump — the last remain...

item.title: How a U.S. government shutdown could impact your benefits and services
item.description: The U.S. government could face a shutdown at 12:01 a.m. on Saturday, December 21. Here's what could be impacted.
